original: Jonasson, Olof Georg, professor, Göteborg, f. 22/1/94 i Berg, Kronob. 1., av Anders-Johan J. o. Hanna Carlsson. G. m. Sigrid Fagerström. Barn: Nils-Olof f. 29, Berit 33, Ingrid 36. — Stud:ex. v. Växjö h. a. 1. 13, ekon. ex. v. HHS 16, fil. kand. i Sthlm 21 o. fil. lic. där 22, Dr. phil. v. Clark Univ. i Worcester i USA 26. Assist, prof. v. Clark Univ. 25-26, doc. i råprod:-lära v. HHS 26, tf. prof. i ekon. geogr. o. råprod:lära där 28-34, tf. prof. i geogr. m. hand :geogr. v. Gbgs högsk. 35-37, doc. o. huv:’lär. i ekon. geogr. v. Gbgs hand:högsk. 37, prof. i ekon. geogr. m. råprod :lära där sed. 39. Led. av styr. f. bl. a. Sv. ekonom-fören. v. krets, A-B Aspenäs Villastad, A-B Tomtcentr., Smål. gille o. Geogr. fören., ordf. i Travellers Club, Gbgs hand :högsk. IF o. Gbgs akad. idr :-fören. Medl. av Göta Coldinu-Orden. Skr.: The Agriculturad Regions of Europé (diss., publ. i Econ. Geogr. 25-26), Ekon. geogr. m. varukännedom (6. uppl. 42), Kaffet o. kaffeländerna (32), Varutrafiken m. bil t. o. fr. Sthlm 32 (offentl. utredn. 34), Sthlms varutrafik m. in- o. uti. (34), Jord-br:atlas över Sv:e (tills. m. Th. Björkman o. E. Höijer 37), Livsmed :han-deins varukännedom (ti’lls. m. A. Bengtsson, 3. uppl. 42), Den sv. världssjöfarten (karta m. text 43), Gbg som ind:-, hand:- o. sjöfartsstad (43) m. fl. Hobbies: resor, jordbr:arb., sport. RNO, NyaSvM.
translated: Jonasson, Olof Georg, professor, Gothenburg, born January 22, 1894 in Berg, Kronoberg County, son of Anders-Johan J. and Hanna Carlsson. Married to Sigrid Fagerström. Children: Nils-Olof born in 1929, Berit in 1933, and Ingrid in 1936. He passed his studentexamen (university entrance exam) at Växjö high school in 1913, earned a Bachelor of Economics degree from the Stockholm School of Economics in 1916, a Bachelor of Arts degree in Stockholm in 1921, and a Doctor of Philosophy degree from Clark University in Worcester, USA in 1926. He served as an assistant professor at Clark University from 1925-1926, was a docent in raw materials science at Stockholm School of Economics in 1926, acting professor in economic geography and raw materials science there from 1928-1934, acting professor of geography and trade geography at the University of Gothenburg from 1935-1937, a lecturer and chief teacher of economic geography at the Gothenburg School of Commerce from 1937, and a professor of economic geography and raw materials science there since 1939. He was a member of the board of several organizations, including the Swedish Economic Society, the Aspenäs Villastad Corporation, the Tomtcompany, the Småland guild, and the Geographical Society. He was also the chairman of the Travellers Club, the Gothenburg School of Commerce's IF sports club, and the Gothenburg Academy Sports Association. He was a member of the Göta Coldinu Order. His publications include The Agricultural Regions of Europe (dissertation, published in Econ. Geogr. 25-26), Economic Geography with Commodity Knowledge (6th edition in 1942), Coffee and Coffee Countries (1932), Commodity Traffic by Car to and from Stockholm (official investigation from 1934), Stockholm's Commodity Traffic with and without Sweden (1934), Agricultural Atlas of Sweden (together with Th. Björkman and E. Höijer in 1937), Knowledge of Food Trade (together with A. Bengtsson, 3rd edition in 1942), The Swedish World Shipping (map with text in 1943), and Gothenburg as an Industrial, Commercial, and Shipping City (1943) among others. His hobbies include travel, agriculture, and sports. He was awarded the RNO (Knight of the Order of the North Star) and was a member of the New Swedish Dictionary.
